file_content.text: I wonder if Selonians can be domesticated. Have a little girl back on Korriban. She's dying for a new pet.
I cleared out the Selonian warren.
I knew I had a good feeling about you.
Maybe now that the Selonians have seen what happens to wild animals, they'll start acting like the civilized creatures they claim they are.
Putting down strays is noble work. Take pride in that.
These Corellians are something, aren't they? Bomb their cities and they come right back and blow up your shuttle.
Miles of heart, these people. Bought themselves a world of hurt, but darned if they haven't earned my respect!
Now the Selonians, them I could do without. Vicious, feral things, killing with tooth and claw. Probably crawling with diseases, too.
You're being too soft on the Corellians. We should just enslave them all and be done with it.
The locals are just as bad.
It may come to that, I suppose. But the mongrels wouldn't even make good slaves.
Don't waste your time fretting over those mongrels.
They're nothing to worry over.
Positive thinking. I like that.
I'm only interested in your problems if there's money in it.
Are we talking about a job?
Yes, of course. All business.
There's nothing to suggest they're more disease-ridden than other sentients.
Diseases? Not that I've heard.
I suppose. Still, would it kill them to wear pants?
You talk about them like they're animals.
They're intelligent beings.
"Animals" is such a strong word. But I like it.
You said it.
The Selonians fancy themselves warriors, but they fight like beasts, leaving only pieces of our soldiers behind.
One pack in particular has taken special delight in savaging my troops. I need someone to find these strays and put them down.
I'll handle it.
Sounds easy.
Now that's the kind of initiative this Empire needs!
You'll find the Selonian warren nearby. Exterminate them like the vermin they are.
Won't be me. [Refuse quest]
I hope you'll reconsider.
I'd enjoy this fine Corellian air a whole lot more if it wasn't tainted by the stench of Selonian fur.
